1.title: Yelani
1.subtitle: Yelani products are specifically designed and created for women with naturally curly hair. The product line features chemical free hair care products made from 100% natural ingredients.

products.name: Moisture Blast Conditioning Shampoo
products.description: Infused with natural and top quality ingredients known for their moisturizing properties, our Moisture Blast Conditioning Shampoo gently hydrates, strengthens, deeply moisturizes and revitalizes dull and dry hair.

products.name: Herbal Beard Oil
products.description: Infused with a refreshing blend of all natural ingredients – grape seed, natural oils, essential fatty acids, jojoba and vitamin E – Yelani Men Beard Oil is essential for your beard needs.

products.name: Hand Sanitizer - Rosemary
products.description: Our 8 oz,  liquid hand sanitizer is easily applied with a fine mist spray. It contains 70% alcohol and ships from within the USA.

1.title: Support the Milwaukee Freedom Fund
1.subtitle: The Milwaukee Freedom Fund is extending support to protestors in Kenosha, WI. Their mission is to build on ongoing bail abolition efforts, support immigration efforts, work towards Black and Brown Liberation, and support Black and Brown young people as they build a new world.

2.title: AcARRE
2.subtitle: AcARRE™ is a natural prestige brand of multi-use bioactive beauty products for the beauty minimalist to age beautifully, based on modernized African and Pacific Islander ancestry elements delivering multi-level benefits, bringing balance to the skin.

2.title: Diarrablu
2.subtitle: The Diarrablu mission is to iterate for sustainability while highlighting the African continent’s rich colors and unique patterns through practical and versatile pieces designed using mathematical concepts or algorithms.

products.name: Sustainable Mailys Dress - Noir
products.description: Sustainable, artisanal and size inclusive, the Mailys Dress is easily convertible into over 19 different styles. This garment is a comfortable and versatile dress thoughtfully designed to fit all body shapes and sizes.

products.name: Headwrap - Suto
products.description: These statement pieces are part of our zero-waste sustainable approach as we believe in maximizing the usage of all our fabrics.

products.name: Hidden in Ocho Rios | Art Print
products.description: In this piece, we daydream of an impromptu retreat in Ocho Rios, Jamaica in a hidden tree-house covered in palm leaves.

3.title: Mutt's Sauce
3.subtitle: In 1956, Mutt got the idea to make a sauce he could use for every meal. Mutt’s sauce was a multi-purpose specialty sauce, infusing sweet, tangy and a little bit of heat into each spoonful.

products.name: Combo 3 Pack
products.description: BEST VALUE! Try all three: Original, Sweet N Spicy, Ghost Pepper

products.name: Deluxe Spices 3 Pack
products.description: It took 7 years to decide on what flavors to introduce in our spice line. These spices are unique because when paired with Mutt's Sauce, you can create three limited edition flavors.

products.name: Deluxe Combo Pack — Sauce + Spices
products.description: This is the ultimate gift for Cooking with Mutt's Sauce!  Try the sauces:  Gluten Free Original, Sweet N Spicy, and Ghost Pepper, as well as our new line of spices: Berbere, Garlic Ghost Pepper, and Onion Pepper.

3.title: Racially Targeted Arrests in the Era of Marijuana Reform
3.subtitle: For decades, marijuana laws have been used to criminalize Black and Brown people, waste taxpayer money, and fuel the mass incarceration crisis. However, states across the country are taking strides toward reforming these outdated and harmful policies.

4.title: Book: Understanding Mass Incarceration
4.subtitle: A People's Guide to the Key Civil Rights Struggle of Our Time

4.title: Sweet Pea Books Inc
4.subtitle: Sweet Pea Books is dedicated to producing multicultural books that expose, inspire, amuse, and foster a love of reading in all children. Sweet Pea Books aims to promote the development of good character by teaching values through literature as well as expose young readers to different cultures.

products.name: D Is For Dragon Fruit (Hardcover)
products.description: D is for Dragon Fruit is a vibrantly illustrated, exotic fruit alphabet book that exposes children to a variety of nutritious fruits, reinforces the alphabet and expands a child’s knowledge of the world.

products.name: When Mama Braids My Hair (Hardcover)
products.description: When Mama Braids My Hair captures a young girl’s experience of having her hair braided and the bond it creates with her mother. The tradition of African hair braiding is more than just a Sunday routine. Come join Nikki on an adventure as she is transformed into an Egyptian queen, a Nigerian goddess, a Zulu warrior, and a Maasai girl.

products.name: Elephants Don't Have Stripes! (COMING SOON!)
products.description: Elephants Don’t Have Stripes! Deep in the valley, in the dry grasslands of the African savanna, a young elephant admires other animals for their beauty. He yearns to look and act more like them. One by one, each wish comes true and the young elephant couldn’t be happier.

5.title: Alter Planning Co.
5.subtitle:
Alter Planning Co was founded by scottie., a young artist and entrepreneur who grew tired of looking for the perfect planner every year. She crafted each product to help fuel the creativity and productivity of those who used it. 

As an artist, scottie. has a deep understanding of the need for structure and wants to inspire more people to create routines and form in their life.

5.title: glAze
5.subtitle: glAze represents those that don't believe it takes much to create an amazing look. We are the stealthy, the un-gawdy, enjoy pale hues and monochromatic splendor yet can switch it up and get really BOLD!

6.title: Justice for the Murder of Rayshard Brooks
6.subtitle: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed, 27 year old Black man was murdered after 3 officers responded to complaints of him sleeping in his vehicle in the Wendy’s parking lot. After struggling with the officers, Brooks began to run for his life, when he was shot in the back more than once.

6.title: 360 Magazine
6.subtitle:
360 is an edgy fashion, lifestyle and culture magazine. We will introduce cutting-edge brands, entities and trends to tastemakers within their respective communities. Our founding members have over 30 years of collective experience both as notable talent and uber professionals within the realm of fashion, music, art, design and entertainment. We are more than just a magazine comprised of journalists, representing a movement of social awareness and change.

We are a LGBTQIA friendly publication. The magazine is contemporary in look and appeal. Quality art content is the constant goal. The magazine will be entertaining, newsworthy and thought-provoking. It will appeal to a broad entertainment readership. No magazine like it is available today, constantly celebrating racial and sexual ambiguous talent and artists.

7.title: How students of color confront impostor syndrome
7.subtitle: As a black woman from a tough part of the Bronx who grew up to attain all the markers of academic prestige, Dena Simmons knows that for students of color, success in school sometimes comes at the cost of living authentically. Now an educator herself, Simmons discusses how we might create a classroom that makes all students feel proud of who they are.

7.title: Kids Swag
7.subtitle: Great action is taking place to improve diversity in books and dolls and there are a number of different vendors making it easier to find these great items. But what about everything else in your child's world? You go grocery shopping, what image is on the cute plate and cup set your child wants? You're want to encourage their creativity, what images are in their colouring books? You're throwing a birthday party, what are your options?
7.moreInfo: The list can go on and on. It is an unnecessarily complicated task to source and purchase everyday lifestyle products for children that have black images. These companies exist but one must be internet savvy and social media literate to find them. KIDS SWAG was launched in December 2016 to make it easy for parents to build environments that are reflective of their child's beauty.

products.name: Nia Ballerina Backpack
products.description: This beautifully illustrated pink rucksack is the perfect accessory for your little ballerina, which is both lightweight and practical with plenty of storage. Made from durable and water-resistant material this rucksack features a colourful design with two images of Nia Ballerina on the front.

products.name: Nana Yaa
products.description: Nana means Queen or King in West Africa , Ghana. The founders of Nana Dolls wanted to teach the younger generation of their history whilst also having fun. There were many strong courageous women from all over Africa who helped to fight for freedom.

products.name: Super Friends Onesie
products.description: Your little Superhero featured as your favourite Superhero.

8.title: Natural Cuties
8.subtitle: Natural Cuties is a brand that promotes, encourages and highlights the beauty of African American hair in its natural state! #Iamanaturalcutie are you?

products.name: I am a Natural Cutie Book
products.description: Phoenix is excited about rocking her big afro puffs on the first day of Kindergarten. After hearing the other girls make fun of her puffs she is ready to go home. She will soon learn just what it means to be a NATURAL Cutie!

products.name: Drawstring Bag
products.description: Combine your love for vibrant prints and a sporty style with a cool drawstring bag. It’s a must-have gym essential that can be worn as a backpack with drawstring closure at top, and narrow, contrasting shoulder straps.

products.name: Mug
products.description: Whether you’re drinking your morning coffee, your evening tea, or something in between – this mug’s for you! It’s sturdy and glossy with a vivid print that’ll withstand the microwave and dishwasher.

8.title: The Better Results
8.subtitle: The Better Results Push bar was created to solve a Problem, the equipment has been patented and now the hopes in every one can benefit from the invention.

products.name: Gun Metal Grey

products.description: BR is the 1st high quality one-piece close grip push-up bar. . The BR Push-up Bar gives you the proper diamond shape push-up form without hurting or straining your wrist. Use of BR provides definition in chest and tricep areas.

products.description: BR is the 1st high quality one-piece close grip push-up bar. . The BR Push-up Bar gives you the proper diamond shape push-up form without hurting or straining your wrist. Use of BR provides definition in chest and tricep areas.

9.title: Soul Cap
9.subtitle: Haircare for the volume-blessed. Being blessed with voluminous hair shouldn’t come with the curse of harsh chemicals or mediocre products.

9.title: Derek Chauvin sentencing
9.subtitle: A Hennepin County jury found Derek Chauvin guilty on all three counts against him on Tuesday, April 20, 2021, setting the stage for the sentencing of the former Minneapolis officer. Here's what we know about when sentencing will happen and what to expect.

10.title: Netflix Explained: Racial Wealth Gap
10.subtitle: Cory Booker and others discuss how slavery, housing discrimination and centuries of inequality have compounded to create a racial wealth gap.

10.title: Bossa Bars
10.subtitle: Energy bars formulated for women perimenopause to post to help support daily nutritional needs and keep that sneaky extra 10 pounds under control!

11.title: Seven factors that contribute to American racism
11.subtitle: Of the seven factors the researchers identified, perhaps the most insidious is passivism or passive racism, which includes an apathy toward systems of racial advantage or denial that those systems even exist.

11.title: Justice for Tete Gulley
11.subtitle: Tete Gulley was a 31 year old queer Black transient. She was also known by some of her family as Otis. She was found hanging from a tree on the evening of May 27th 2019 in Rocky Butte Park. The cause of death was determined to be suicide at the scene but there is evidence of foul play.

12.title: 10 killed in "racially motivated" mass shooting at Buffalo supermarket
12.subtitle: Police said the shooter has been charged with murder in what officials are calling a hate crime and a case of racially motivated violent extremism.

12.title: Innocence Project
12.subtitle: Donate to help free the innocent. The Innocence Project exonerates the wrongly convicted through DNA testing and reforms the criminal justice system to prevent future injustices.

13.title: Did you really just say that?
13.subtitle: Here's advice on how to confront microaggressions, whether you're a target, bystander or perpetrator

13.title: Smell Good Spa
13.subtitle: Established in 1998, we are purveyors of aromatic products for women who are making a conscientious change in their personal care products. Our products are the cherry-on-top for women who love to live good, feel good and smell good, wholesomely.

14.title: What I am learning from my white grandchildren
14.subtitle: Are we in a post-racial society? Do we want to be? Anthony Peterson, an African American, draws from current research and from conversations with his Anglo American grandchildren to address truths about race in 21st century America.

14.title: Let Sha'Carri Run!
14.subtitle: Sign the petition to reinstate Sha'Carri Richardson and allow this world-class athlete to compete in the 100-meter dash! And revisit the outdated rules around marijuana and athletes.

15.title: Dawoud Bey: The Birmingham Project
15.subtitle: In 2005 American photographer Dawoud Bey visited Birmingham, Alabama, to explore the possibility of making work that would commemorate the September 15, 1963, bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church. The Birmingham Project, a series that includes photographic diptychs and a split-screen video, is Bey’s powerful response.

15.title: Jackie Robinson's Effect on the Negro Leagues & MLB | 'Field of Dreams...Deferred'
15.subtitle: Things actually got tougher for Black baseball players after Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier, as MLB teams followed racist quotas and the Negro Leagues died out. "Many talented Black players got phased out."

16.title: MLK: The Other America
16.subtitle: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.’s 1967 speech at Stanford. Here, he expounds on his nonviolent philosophy and methodology.

16.title: Juneteenth is a federal holiday. What comes next?
16.subtitle: As President Biden signed the Juneteenth National Independence Day Act into law, he acknowledged a current struggle for voting rights.

17.title: YTPshop - African Clothing
17.subtitle: All YTPshop products are crafted by women in Nigeria and the fabrics are carefully sourced from West African markets. YTPshop products are made with high-quality material, cutting edge tailoring, vibrant colors, and are affordably priced.

17.title: POWERHANDZ
17.subtitle: POWERHANDZ is a global company that manufactures unique skill development products used by thousands of professional and youth athletes in multiple sports.

products.name: Basketball Gift Set

products.description: Set includes 5 resistance bands, 2 sliding disks, and a bag for storage.

18.title: 210 Teas
18.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

18.title: When the first all-black professional basketball team dominated...back in the ’20s
18.subtitle: "They were literally pioneers and recognized that they were making a statement in front of the audiences."

19.title: Accountability in a Time of Justice
19.subtitle: Accountability is a well-worn word in social justice circles. We have worked hard to figure out what accountability means to us as we attempt to walk our social justice talk.

19.title: The Afro Gypsy
19.subtitle: I create jewelry and accessories that enhance the uniqueness of you; we like to call it Bohemian with an AFRO-tude! My work predominantly consist of leather and metalwork items. But, considering my love for the extraordinary, you may stumble upon many other new or vintage items that could steal your heart!

products.name: Unisex African Bead Bracelets paired with Lava or Wood Beads
products.description: African Bead Bracelets paired with Lava or Wood Beads. Sultry and handsome, these bracelets are all hand made with stretch cord.

products.name: Handmade Journal
products.description: Handmade journal covered in luxurious upcycled upholstery with a hand sewn leather trim. This 96-page journal is ready to hold your secrets and hear your dreams. 3.75" w × 6.7" h.

products.name: Large Amethyst Pendant Necklace
products.description: Hand wired Large Amethyst pendant necklace with 14K Antiqued GP chain and findings.

20.title: Controversy over Confederate monuments is overdue
20.subtitle: As Confederate monuments and memorials are toppled across the United States, Stanford historian James T. Campbell says it is important to think historically not only about the past but also about our own time and what future generations might say about us.

20.title: Automotive Heroes of Black History Month
20.subtitle: Ever wonder what driving would be like without turn signals or traffic lights? Well, without these great inventors, engineers, scientists, and pioneers of their field, driving wouldn’t be what it is today! In celebration of Black History Month, we want to share a few of their exciting stories with you.

21.title: How studying privilege systems can strengthen compassion
21.subtitle: Her TED Talk offers a shift in the traditional view of race, equity and privilege. McIntosh uses her own experience as a white woman to inform her own knowledge of racial experiences from a white perspective.

21.title: Camella's Kitchen
21.subtitle: Camella’s Kitchen is helping you to elevate your meals at home and on the go with our bold Caribbean flavors – we ship. We started Camella's Kitchen in order to honor the memory of and carry on lessons learned from Ms. Camella, our mother and grandmother respectively.

products.name: Pumpkin Spice Pepper Sauce
products.description: Satisfy your cravings for pumpkin spice and heat with this flavorful hot sauce! Filled with pumpkin and savory spices, this will make the perfect travel-size treat for the fall!

products.name: Spicy Mango Chutney
products.description: Savory mango sauce that’s a combo of fruity and spicy. Use this condiment to liven up your gatherings or just keep it for yourself 😉. This mango chutney will be a spicy hit!

products.name: Caribbean Fruit Cake
products.description: Traditional Caribbean fruit cake (black cake) enhanced with tropical spices and preserved with rum. Just a small slice of this decadent cake will transport you to the islands!

22.title: Whistling Vivaldi
22.subtitle: Claude M. Steele, who has been called "one of the few great social psychologists," offers a vivid first-person account of the research that supports his groundbreaking conclusions on stereotypes and identity.

22.title: All Hip-Hop
22.subtitle:
AllHipHop.com was founded and launched in 1998 by CEO’s "Grouchy" Greg Watkins and Chuck "Jigsaw" Creekmur.

After many years of developing the site, AllHipHop.com has become a valuable resource for hip-hop on the internet, featuring daily news, interviews, reviews, multimedia, a fast growing community and other interesting content.

Publications such as CNN, The Source, XXL, Complex, New York Post, The New York Times and many others cite AllHipHop.com’s news and features due to our accuracy and trustworthiness.

23.title: The Black Family in the Age of Mass Incarceration
23.subtitle: By author Ta-Nehisi Coates: Fifty years after Daniel Patrick Moynihan’s report “The Negro Family” tragically helped create this system, it's time to reclaim his original intent.

23.title: Build for Black Lives
23.subtitle: Are you an anti-racist designer, developer, data scientist, or marketing specialist interested in committing to pro bono projects to work towards reparations and racial justice? Work on one of our available projects.

24.title: An interview with the founders of Black Lives Matter
24.subtitle: In this spirited conversation with Mia Birdsong, the movement's three founders share what they've learned about leadership and what provides them with hope and inspiration in the face of painful realities. Their advice on how to participate in ensuring freedom for everybody: join something, start something and "sharpen each other, so that we all can rise."

24.title: The Pan-African Congresses, 1900-1945
24.subtitle: In the nearly half century between 1900 and 1945, various political leaders and intellectuals from Europe, North America, and Africa met six times to discuss colonial control of Africa and develop strategies for eventual African political liberation.

25.title: Seventh & Oak
25.subtitle: With self care as our inspiration and sustainability at the hearth of all our products, we craft every candle by hand and with a truckload of love from our home to yours in the hopes that they bring a little more warmth and coziness to your space.

products.name: Zen candle
products.description: When you light the Zen candle, think about how you feel when your space is consumed with good energy and positive thoughts. Burn the Zen candle when you want to cleanse your space to rid it of any negative energy and bring in all the good vibes.

products.name: Namaste candle
products.description: Relaxing lavender beautifully balanced with sweet ylang ylang and grassy vetiver in a recyclable glass jar. Enjoy some time in bed with a good book (or a Netflix show - who's judging?) before heading to bed for your beauty sleep. Just remember to blow it out before drifting off to dreamland.

products.name: Serenity candle
products.description: Fruity but not overpowering; very bright and fresh as each note distinguishes itself. Light up Serenity when you want to freshen up your entryways, kitchens and bathrooms.

25.title: How to deconstruct racism, one headline at a time
25.subtitle: Baratunde Thurston explores the phenomenon of white Americans calling the police on black Americans who have committed the crimes of ... eating, walking or generally "living while black." In this profound, thought-provoking and often hilarious talk, he reveals the power of language to change stories of trauma into stories of healing — while challenging us all to level up.

26.title: Intersectionality Matters! Podcast
26.subtitle: Intersectionality Matters! is a podcast hosted by Kimberlé Crenshaw, an American civil rights advocate and a leading scholar of critical race theory.

26.title: Sienna Sauce
26.subtitle: The award winning Sienna Sauce comes in 3 delicious flavors for every palette. Tangy (the original flavor), Lemon Pepper and Spicy. The Lemon Pepper and Spicy flavors are made with the original flavor being the base of those Sauces. Sienna Sauce has WOWed so many customers, the family based company had to create a subscription program so the Sienna Sauce addicts wouldn’t run out of their favorite sauces.

products.name: Sienna Sauce Variety Pack
products.description: This gourmet sauce has No High Fructose Corn Syrup and is Gluten-Free. It combines the perfect blend of sweet with a hint of tangy serving as a perfect complement to chicken, pork, beef, or seafood that has been fried, smoked, baked, or grilled.

products.name: Sienna Sauce 3 Pack
products.description: This gourmet sauce has No High Fructose Corn Syrup and is Gluten-Free. It combines the perfect blend of sweet with a hint of tangy serving as a perfect complement to chicken, pork, beef, or seafood that has been fried, smoked, baked, or grilled.

products.name: Digital Sauce Lovers E-Book
products.description: Sienna Sauce has released its first e-cookbook! This digital flavor manual has 4 amazing recipes by celebrity chef, Jabril Riddick, Along with the champion recipe from Sienna Sauce's Virtual Cook-Off.

27.title: Harvard student penned textbook on racial literacy
27.subtitle: Winona Guo '22 co-authored a book on race, culture, and identity as a resource for teachers.

27.title: United Negro College Fund
27.subtitle: UNCF envisions a nation where all Americans have equal access to a college education that prepares them for rich intellectual lives, competitive and fulfilling careers, engaged citizenship and service to our nation.

28.title: White Privilege: Unpacking the Invisible Knapsack
28.subtitle: As a white person, I realized I had been taught about racism as something that puts others at a disadvantage, but had been taught not to see one of its corollary aspects, white privilege, which puts me at an advantage.

28.title: Soul Impactful
28.subtitle: Soul Impactful strongly believes in the divine power of the universe and we also believe that every being has access to this Source. Our purpose is to provide you with tools to aid you in your spiritual journey and cheer on your glo' up!

products.name: Chalcedony 108 Bead Meditation Bracelet
products.description: A quiet moment of reflection, gratitude, and visualization is sometimes all that is needed to redirect your mentality in a positive manner.

products.name: Black Jasper Tumbled Stone
products.description: Black Jasper is a highly protective stone that is excellent for grounding the energies of people who may experience being off with the fairies. It can also help in earthing higher vibrations.

products.name: Bloom and Monk Incense Collection
products.description: Each incense holder is made with exquisite workmanship that creates a meditative effect.

29.title: Bedroom Kandi
29.subtitle: Welcome to Bedroom Kandi, where women, men, and their partners can pamper themselves with intimate luxury! At Bedroom Kandi, our mission is to destigmatize intimacy and self-love, promote sexual wellness and education, and empower entrepreneurs to find success and happiness in the business of pleasure.

29.title: Iltopia Studios
29.subtitle: Iltopia Studios is a small creative studio based in Portland, Oregon. Our objective is simple: make comics and cartoons that open doors to more understanding. Iltopia Studios is dedicated to producing engaging content to our customers at a high quality and a variety of price points. Founded by creator Steven Christian. His goal is to create quirky adventure stories about the Black experience in America that entertains, empowers, and educates. We make cartoons and comics with emerging technology to provide unique and immersive storytelling experiences.

products.name: Cutie Catcher Pack #1
products.description: This Sticker Pack is collections handcrafted stickers by artist Steven Christian. The designs are based on cartoon and comic Eyelnd Feevr.  All sticker are 4” tall, hand cut, and hand laminated. They are great for placing on laptops, skateboards, water bottles, etc. With all the available designs, there is no limit to where you can place them!

products.name: Black Superheroes Matter Artbook
products.description: Black Superheroes Matter Artbook is the original illustration series by Steven Christian aimed at redefining popular superheroes through the eyes of black children. The book includes 110 full color illustrations ranging from anime to Power Rangers. This quirky collection of illustrations is guaranteed to empower and inspire you to redefine you own heroes in your image. Each book is handmade, numbered, and signed by artist Steven Christian.

products.name: Eyelnd Feevr Season 1: Big City, Small Dreemz
products.description: Big City, Small Dreemz is the first Season in the Eyelnd Feevr Webseries. It introduces us to Roscoe Thomason an intelligent, precocious and rebellious 9-year-old. He explores one of his wildest dreams with his best friend Thomas "T.J." Jenkins. As they try to find the true meaning, one must wonder if this is figment of Roscoe's wild imagination or a foreshadowing of what is to come.

30.title: Nia the Loc God
30.subtitle: A natural oil that your hair will love. You are one step closer to moisturized, shiny, healthy hair that smells amazing.

products.description: This hydration mist is the perfect item to add to your haircare routine. 100% natural, also smells 100% like lavender essential oils.  This product will leave your hair super soft and give you an extra boost of hydration and shine.

products.description: Deep cleansing shampoo, with a luxurious smell that will leave your hair clean and not feeling stripped. This shampoo is 100% natural. It will help with dandruff, irritated and or itchy scalp.

30.title: Learn about Julius Jones
30.subtitle: Learn about Julius’ life and what led to his wrongful conviction through Viola Davis' docu-series "The Last Defense."

31.title: White Fragility: Why It's So Hard for White People to Talk About Racism
31.subtitle: This book explicates the dynamics of White Fragility and how we might build our capacity in the on-going work towards racial justice.

31.title: Eb + Flo Boutique
31.subtitle: Eb and Flo started out as just a vision and manifested in 2020. Our CEO, Ebony Hunter, is a strong believer in living out your dreams while not only looking good but feeling good too. Our mission is to provide styles that flow with you from moment to moment, whether you’re making a quick run to the grocery store or meeting the girls for brunch. With comfort and quality in mind, we make looking lavish easy. Look good, feel good.

products.name: Classic Boss Lady Track Suit
products.description: Chic track suit for the lady on the go. Throw it on for a quick trip to the grocery store, a nail appointment, or dress it up for a cute brunch look.

products.name: Tedy Soft Sherpa Jacket
products.description: The warmest and most comfortable jacket you'll ever own! The Teddy Sherpa Jacket feels like a warm hug or like you're wearing a blanket. Features a drawstring hem that allows you to snatch that waist hunny *snap*snap*

products.name: "Thou shall not try me" T-Shirt
products.description: Mood 24:7! Let the folks know the deal in this super soft tee.
